description: Dive into "Chasing Cascades: Waterfalls of Sintra" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Chasing Cascades: Waterfalls of Sintra

places.generalDescription: Fervença waterfall, also known as Bajouca Waterfall, is a picturesque natural wonder located in the town of Fervenca. The gentle cascade flows over mossy ledges and boulders, creating a series of tiered falls into a rocky woodland basin. Its serene and tranquil setting makes it a popular spot for nature lovers and hikers looking to immerse themselves in the beauty of the outdoors.

sources.snippet: Also known as Bajouca Waterfall, it is located in the town of Fervença, and hence known commonly as Fervença Waterfall.

places.name: Fervença waterfall

reviews.text: Fervenca Waterfall, located near the main road in Pero Pinheiro, Sintra, is a hidden gem for nature lovers. This small but captivating waterfall offers a serene escape from the bustling surroundings. The peaceful sound of the cascading water, combined with the lush greenery, creates a perfect spot for relaxation and reflection. Though it's easily accessible, its charm lies in its natural beauty, which feels like a secret retreat. The area surrounding the waterfall is also ideal for a leisurely walk, making it a lovely stop for those exploring the Sintra region. Whether you're seeking tranquility or simply want to enjoy a moment in nature, Fervenca Waterfall is worth visiting.

The waterfall in itself is nice, but the rest! Parked a car not at the nearest place, but slightly afar - was met with a furious barking of a big dog throwing itself on the gate so that it shook... such a shock. I recommend parking as near the waterfall as you can... The area resembles slums: ruined buildings and graffiti. Some people may like it. But looks creepy in the dusk. I met no one there, though, and was safe. Now the path to the waterfall isn't exactly dangerous, but rather unsafe to walk when it's wet. There are slippery stones, dead leaves and a big boulder which you have to climb over using your hands (it's safer so). You can't approach too close unless you want to risk a bit. Sadly, the waterfall itself was dirty, as someone threw rubbish there (pumpkins and fruit, probably pagan offerings or left from Halloween, all rotten and ugly). I felt very sad and disappointed. Of course one can still take nice pictures there... as well as ugly ones. I annex both. It's up to you to decide whether you want to give it a try or not.

We went there in mid February. It was a little hard to find since it is a little down the road of a street. Parking spot is unclear. The best place is around 10 min walk from the waterfall. Easy trail with mostly street walking. Some modern ruins and graphity makes it feel a little "Slummy". But the waterfall was worth the visit in the end.

places.generalDescription: Pisoes Waterfall is a small, charming cascade located near Quinta da Regaleira in Sintra. It flows through high walls along the roadside and offers a stone platform and rest area for visitors to enjoy. While not the main attraction at Quinta da Regaleira, it adds to the overall beauty of the garden. The surrounding area features a mesmerizing combination of flowers and trees, making it a picturesque spot for nature lovers.

sources.snippet: This small waterfall is locate very close to Quinta da Regaleira, flowing through a line of high walls that line the road.

places.name: Pisoes Waterfall

reviews.text:
So mesmerizing beautiful garden with perfect combination of flowers and trees
If u have allergy I suggest you to wear mask there are a lot of flower pollen there

Waterfall must have been insanely beautiful 100 years ago. Nowadays unfortunately are so disgusting and dirty beside old run down industrial area leaking dirt and pollution in the river. Literally revolting.

+ Many beautiful places are located in this.
+ Worth to spend atleast 3 hours
+ Very relaxing place
